questions.a: A Locale object represents a specific geographical, political, or cultural region. It is used for locale-sensitive operations in Java, following local conventions for formatting dates, money, numbers, etc.
x: A Locale is a tool for compiling Java bytecode for different regions.
A Locale is a library for handling database connections in Java.
A Locale is a class used exclusively for timezone management.

questions.q: How will you use a specific Locale in Java?
questions.a: To use a specific Locale, load it using ResourceBundle.getBundle("Locale.UK") method.
x: A specific Locale is set using System.setLocale("Locale.UK").
A specific Locale is applied by modifying the JVM's default settings.
A specific Locale is loaded using Locale.compile("Locale.UK").
